agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A government agency that provides household recycling and hazardous waste collection and education and information about recycling, reusing, and reducing environmental hazards.
service_description: Maintains drop-off sites around Pulaski for collecting recyclables including: corrugated cardboard and box board, newspaper, office paper, junk mail, magazines, glass, steel & aluminum cans, and numbers one and two plastics.
site_details: Walk in, email, call, or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: Recycling Centers
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4pm -- Drop Off: Varies by site

site_schedule.name: Specialized Information and Referral
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4pm -- Drop Off: Varies by site

site_eligibility: Residential households in the county

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. site_details: Walk in.

Living in Pulaski

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: PULASKI MEMORIAL HOSPITAL MEDICAL AND SURGICAL GROUP
service_description: Provides referrals to physicians and services within the Pulaski Memorial Health System.
site_details: Visit website to find physician.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides intensive outpatient mental health counseling services for older adults age 65 or older. Transportation assistance may be available to those living within 40 miles of Pulaski County.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in or call for information or to schedule an appointment. -- Program is approved for traditional Medicare. -- Referrals not required but can be made by family, friends, or physicians/providers.
site_eligibility: Age 65 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight-lifting, and aerobics. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center and fitness classes and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.
site_details: Walk in to join or register for specific programs. Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information about school assignments, eLearning, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12
Living in the Eastern Pulaski Community School district of Pukaski County -- Ages 3-22 -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)
Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Francesville in Pulaski County.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for the town of Francesville in Pulaski County. This department issues permits for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property, and handles zoning requests.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; services limited to properties within Francesville town limits
Open
Open; serves a two-mile radius around the town square of Francesville

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Medaryville in Pulaski County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, and groundskeeping of public properties in the town of Medaryville in Pulaski County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-2pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Medaryville in Pulaski County
Open; serves the town of Medaryville in Puslaski County
Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the town of Winamac in Pulaski County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides water and sanitary sewer utility services for the town of Winamac in Pulaski County.
site_details: Call for assistance. -- Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open; serves  the town of Winamac

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations and businesses to support programs that address human service needs.
service_description: Solicits individual and corporate donations to fund and support partner agencies and programs that address human service needs in Pulaski County. All assistance is provided through partnering agencies; no direct services are provided through this agency.
site_details: Call or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Human services agencies

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Offers monthly delivery of requested library materials (as they are available) to Monterey-Tippecanoe residents who are homebound due to chronic or extended illness, physical disability, or extreme transportation problems.
site_details: Call to request service.

site_schedule.name: Home Library Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 10am-6pm; Tues, Thurs and Fri 11am-5pm; Sat 9am-1pm

site_schedule.name: Computer Literacy Training Programs
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 10am-6pm; Tues, Thurs and Fri 11am-5pm; Sat 9am-1pm

site_schedule.name: Public Libraries
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 10am-6pm; Tues, Thurs and Fri 11am-5pm; Sat 9am-1pm

site_eligibility: Homebound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability
Age 18 or older
For a library card: Living in the town of Monterey or Tippecanoe Township of Pulaski County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents of Salem Township in Pulaski County. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, CDs, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card or Public Library Access Card (PLAC) -- For a resident library card: Living in the town of Francesville or Salem Township of Pulaski County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Pulaski County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Pulaski County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Pulaski County. A ten digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls, including animal-related services. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Pulaski County
Open
To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Pulaski County.  Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for more information

site_schedule.name: Child Support Petition Filing Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Pulaski County

To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Elkhart County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Open

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Pulaski County. Generally, juvenile cases are heard by the Circuit Court and the Superior Court hears traffic and small claims cases.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact County Clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Pulaski County. Generally, juvenile cases are heard by the Circuit Court and the Superior Court hears traffic and small claims cases.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact County Clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Pulaski County, the Superior Court generally handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Pulaski County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Pulaski County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Pulaski County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Pulaski County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Pulaski Courts

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides shelter for stray and unwanted dogs and cats and re-homes animals through adoption. Offers lost-and-found services.
service_description: Provides shelter for stray and unwanted dogs and cats in Pulaski County and rehomes animals through adoption. Offers lost-and-found services, and accepts surrendered animals from the public.
site_details: Walk in or call for information. -- Call the Pulaski County Sheriff to report a stray dog or cat.

site_schedule.schedule: Tues 8am-2pm; Wed by appointment; Thurs 8am-noon and 2pm-6pm; Fri 8am-2pm; Sat 8am-noon

site_schedule.schedule: Tues 8am-2pm; Wed by appointment; Thurs 8am-noon and 2pm-6pm; Fri 8am-2pm; Sat 8am-noon

site_schedule.schedule: Tues 8am-2pm; Wed by appointment; Thurs 8am-noon and 2pm-6pm; Fri 8am-2pm; Sat 8am-noon

To Donate: Open -- To Volunteer: Age 13 or older, with parental consent

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Winamac in Pulaski County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Winamac in Pulaski County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For non emergency services, call the office during business hours or call Pulaski County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Winamac in Pulaski County

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Pulaski County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Pulaski County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on property description and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Pulaski County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in Pulaski County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in Pulaski County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Varies by service; serves Pulaski County
Age 19 or older
Living in Pulaski County

Living in Pulaski County -- Testing is recommended for any child age 6 months-6 years who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in Pulaski County
Varies by service; call for information.

Living in Pulaski County -- Age 2 months-18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- Native American or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.

site_schedule.schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
